lexUnit.name: press.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make strong efforts to persuade or force to do something.

sentence.text: The sponsors of the bill made clear their intention to press for a vote on it within the current legislative session .
Anne McIntosh , MEP for North East Essex , is pressing the Government to reverse its policy of controlled retreat , which allows the sea to gradually take its natural course .
Lewis pressed Adam to accompany him on those solicitous weekend visits but Adam nearly always said he was too busy or would be bored .
The committee also agreed to press for changes to the rule which limits the level of right-to-buy discounts in the case of newly built houses or those recently modernised .
It is no secret that Damascus has been using the PKK as a bargaining chip to press Turkey into complying with its demands for more water from the Euphrates , on which it heavily depends .
The tenant 's adviser should therefore press for an obligation on the landlord to notify the tenant of any application made by him to the President .
They press for much needed democratic reforms to enable the citizens to participate .
When I press him for more names he suddenly gets the deer-caught-in-the-headlights look , and , deciding he 's already revealed too much , replies , ` Ah , just people . "
In these circumstances the Soviet Union has pressed more recently for a more limited regime for the Gulf involving restrictions on the naval presence of the Great Powers in the region .
Mr Gorbachev may refrain from saying it publicly on Saturday but he can be expected to press Mr Honecker all the more urgently in private .
The houses of Hohenstaufen ( Ghibellines ) and Welf ( Guelphs ) both pressed their claims to the royal crown but as already described , Frederick Barbarossa succeeded in his claim .
BRITISH Petroleum is to press Chancellor Norman Lamont for a reduction in North Sea taxes and is making additional cuts in capital spending to avoid the risks of further cash and dividend pressures .
We will press them to put into practice the principles of the Maastricht declaration .
Once in office Healey pressed his Nato colleagues to accept that no conflict was possible in Europe at any level between that of a local skirmish and all-out war .
Suppose she was pressing him to pay it back because she needed it for her vineyard . "
I would n't press you for a decision , I promise you .
We will press for similar standards throughout the European Community and strengthen the work of consumer groups and advice centres so that the aspirations and standards are met .
Senior Tories pressed Michael Heseltine , the environment secretary , to discuss radical changes to the poll tax .
